intro: Streblosiopsis cupulata, commonly known as the cup-shaped lichen, is a foliose lichen that belongs to the family Pertusariaceae. It is characterized by its leaf-like thallus that is typically cup-shaped or lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with green algae, which contributes to its photosynthetic capabilities. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks and rocks in temperate regions. Its slow growth and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
